intro: Guapira ayacuchae, commonly known as the Ayacuchan guapira, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1–2 meters and features opposite, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in cymes, often appearing in spring. The plant is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in humid, shaded areas within cloud forests.
